thread.title_full: Trump names Border Patrol chief - POLITICO

author: Ted Hesson
title: names Border Patrol chief
text:
President Donald Trump on Tuesday named Ronald Vitiello the new head of Border Patrol, a swift appointment following the resignation of the agency’s chief last week. The outgoing chief, Mark Morgan, was forced out of his job, according to a report by The Associated Press. The move came shortly after Trump issued an executive order to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border — which Trump had promised he'd do during the campaign — and crack down on illegal immigration.
Morgan took office in October and was expected to tackle corruption within the agency.
However, the former FBI official — the first outsider to helm Border Patrol in its 92-year history — did not appear destined to remain in the Trump administration.
During his short tenure, Morgan appeared to lose the support of the National Border Patrol Council, a union that represents 18,000 agents.
Members of the union’s executive board published an op-ed on Breitbart's website in November that called Morgan “a disgrace to the Border Patrol” who “does not have the will necessary to secure the border.”

The union endorsed Trump in the presidential election and maintains influence within his administration.
Vitiello has earned praise from union officials. He served as acting chief of Border Patrol for nearly a year before handing the reins to Morgan.
The union thanked Vitiello in a statement issued at the time.
“Deputy Chief Vitiello has served as an example of what all law enforcement managers should strive to be: a fair, competent leader who took care of his people while accomplishing the mission,” the statement said.
